channel.title: Compression tool help
channel.description:
Okay, can't get my compression tool to work. Don't know how or why. I've searched all over forums and google and I can't find any answers because theres no actual tutorial on how to get it to work. People have told me it should just work when I download it, but it hasn't any of the 5 times I've redownloaded it. heres the message im getting.
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: DefCompressor Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: DefCompressor at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: DefCompressor. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .
If anyone can walk me through maybe what might be the problem that would be great. As you know, I can't really add or remove anything important until I get this fixed.

item.title: Compression tool help
item.dc:creator: @professionalnoob professionalnoob
item.description:
@professionalnoob wrote:

I would say yes you have, if I knew what you were saying lol. where do I put this in? no matter what paths i set in compression tool is always gives me the same message. could no find or load main class defcompressor. This compression tool has been a problem for me for literally 6 months, and no one can give me any help on or answers on how to fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: Compression tool help
item.dc:creator: @Aleksandr_Volkov Aleksandr Volkov
item.description:
@Aleksandr_Volkov wrote:

That error just means DefCompressor is not in your classpath. You can set it as a command-line option, e.g.

or you can use any gzip compression tool I believe, as I’ve used the GNU implementation for a client I was testing.

Hope I helped!

Read full topic

item.title: Compression tool help
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

did you try open the archive with 7zip and then drag and drop your edited file inside the 7zip window? That should be enough, i guess lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Compression tool help
item.dc:creator: @professionalnoob professionalnoob
item.description:
@professionalnoob wrote:

Team_Rocket:

Using a Batch place “-cp .;” before the Class is named.

I have no idea what this means lol. Can you explain?

Read full topic

item.title: Compression tool help
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Using a Batch place “-cp .;” before the Class is named.

Read full topic

item.title: Compression tool help
item.dc:creator: @professionalnoob professionalnoob
item.description:
@professionalnoob wrote:

the problem isn’t decompressing them, its compressing them back into rscd files. I don’t know how to do that was 7zip

Read full topic

item.title: Compression tool help
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

For .rscd files you can use 7zip

But still i think they’re just zip files.

Read full topic

item.title: Compression tool help

item.description:
@professionalnoob wrote:

Okay, can’t get my compression tool to work. Don’t know how or why. I’ve searched all over forums and google and I can’t find any answers because theres no actual tutorial on how to get it to work. People have told me it should just work when I download it, but it hasn’t any of the 5 times I’ve redownloaded it. heres the message im getting.
